etymologies: mid 17th century: variant of obsolete sailer

definitions: a person whose job it is to work as a member of the crew of a commercial or naval ship or boat, especially one who is below the rank of officer

examples.text: Hawaii was an important stopping point for sailors to restock provisions

shortDefinitions: person whose job it is to work as member of crew of commercial or naval ship or boat

definitions: a person who goes sailing as a sport or recreation

notes.text: usually with adjective or noun modifier

shortDefinitions: person who goes sailing as sport or recreation

definitions: a person who rarely (or often) becomes sick at sea in rough weather.
shortDefinitions: person who rarely or often becomes sick at sea in rough weather
